title: Looking for a font similar font to Elephant but in a light weight
content:
Hi  
This is my first post on this forum.

I'm looking for a similar font to this one (Elephant), but in a light weight. Any suggestions?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150225214655im_/http:/typophile.com/files/elephant_5326.jpg)

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [elephant.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150225214655/http:/typophile.com/files/elephant.jpg) | 18.2 KB |
author: mrpallarp

comments.content:
I’d suggest a Century, although the italics aren’t as slanted as in your sample.

[http://www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=Century+expanded+italic](http://web.archive.org/web/20150225214655/http:/www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=Century+expanded+italic "http://www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=Century+expanded+italic")

More weights:

[http://www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=ITC+Century](http://web.archive.org/web/20150225214655/http:/www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=ITC+Century "http://www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=ITC+Century")
You want as much contrast (very thin serifs)?
Bald Condensed: Yes, I'm looking for something with strong contrast, just not quite as thick as Elephant is.

There must be some kind of Bodoni Italic amongst all the different versions that's lighter than that.

Nick Cooke
